channel.title: Project Pooeybum [Runesource][Completed]
channel.description:
Hello and welcome to Project Pooeybum based off of Runesource.
My aim in this project is to create a source, to be released, which will be easy to use and have fully functioning combat (the bit people are scared of having to write themselves). So far I have had what I consider to be great progress. There are bugs, lots of them. Hopefully not too many in my combat system, but as for the rest of the source I find myself stumbling into one every few minutes. (I do fix them :P)
So to summarise:
What I have done: Fix quite a few bugs Add an entity based combat system Added most of the combat related spells (just gotta get off my ass to add the rest) Ranging with everything except throwing knives working Added the interfaces for weapons Loaded item bonuses via an xml file. Actually, I loaded quite a lot of additional stuff via xml. Learnt that people who write good combat systems deserve a pat on the back.
I hate all this business of writing all your goals and then colouring them all red (who cares what you intend to do but haven't yet done)
Anyway, here is a video to show that I mean business:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5f_6njV_I7A
ALSO! If anyone knows the emote for casting slayer darts' id... I will be very happy.
UPDATES: As of yesterday I added a special attack system and so far have the dragon dagger and the whip working. I used the old whip effect instead of the new one (you either hit nothing or your max hit) Weapons with the suffix '(p)', '(p+)' or '(p++)' all now do poison damage at the correct amounts. Ancient spells have now all been added including area effects and poison effects. The health drain and attack draining effects have not been added yet. End graphics all are at the right heights now (unlike in the video).
As I am releasing this for /YOUR/ use I would really appreciate your input as to what you would like to see. (Obviously leave anything too interesting for you to do yourself :))
I think the entire development may be broken as the source no longer works with any client unless I remove NPC loading and I have no clue as to why.
Note on the above: I got a client to work again but that is the last time I even attempt to compile the client, yet alone try and get prayer head icons. Clients just hate me.
[u][i][b][size=10pt]IN REGARDS TO THE NAME: [/size][/b][/i][/u] This is the internet. What did you actually expect? This place has the maturity of a toddler and a dick to prove it. I think you fellas need to stop judging a book by its cover. It's not like the name means shit anyway, it is going to be released straight away. I repeat, IT IS NEVER GOING TO BE HOSTED BY ME, WITH THIS NAME.
The first prototype has been released! [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,541803.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,541803.0.html[/url]
Note on the development: As far as I am concerned I have achieved my goal with this. I have released a copy of Runesource that has fully functioning combat and I feel the rest is up to you. I'll be moving onto developing my own server from this now. :) Goodluck,

item.title: Project Pooeybum [Runesource][Completed]
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

[quote=“Advocatus, post:34, topic:438733”][quote author=BorigTheDwarf link=topic=541440.msg3974276#msg3974276 date=1334472332]

Not sure if Stonefall is different(supposedly is runesource too) but you could check it out too…

Basic event handling system - Actions can be delayed or repeated using a simple threaded event handler. Can fire events in multiples of ticks, seconds, minutes and hours.

Thank you, I will look into it. But to be completely honest I am happy with it as it is. Runescape runs entirely on 600ms as far as I know so I don’t see why I should change it for this. But then, it is up to you the user to tell me what to add so I guess I’ll give it a shot when I get home
[/quote]
Goodluck with this. I wouldn’t bother looking at stonefall, all it does is run events/ the server tick off of a scheduled executor service.[/quote]

Runescape runs entirely on a 600ms tick. So I must assume I have done it the right way, unless, you are exclusively referring to the magic hit splats in which case you can change the speed of the gfx and therefore make it match more closely to the hitsplat.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Pooeybum [Runesource][Completed]
item.dc:creator: @Advocatus Advocatus
item.description:
@Advocatus wrote:

[quote=“BorigTheDwarf, post:33, topic:438733”][quote author=latifundio link=topic=541440.msg3973597#msg3973597 date=1334415975]
Not sure if Stonefall is different(supposedly is runesource too) but you could check it out too…

Basic event handling system - Actions can be delayed or repeated using a simple threaded event handler. Can fire events in multiples of ticks, seconds, minutes and hours.

[/quote]

Thank you, I will look into it. But to be completely honest I am happy with it as it is. Runescape runs entirely on 600ms as far as I know so I don’t see why I should change it for this. But then, it is up to you the user to tell me what to add so I guess I’ll give it a shot when I get home :)[/quote]
Goodluck with this. I wouldn’t bother looking at stonefall, all it does is run events/ the server tick off of a scheduled executor service.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Pooeybum [Runesource][Completed]
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

[quote=“latifundio, post:32, topic:438733”]Not sure if Stonefall is different(supposedly is runesource too) but you could check it out too…

[quote author=Wintercanon link=topic=481040.msg3522323#msg3522323 date=1299488743]
Basic event handling system - Actions can be delayed or repeated using a simple threaded event handler. Can fire events in multiples of ticks, seconds, minutes and hours.
[/quote][/quote]

Thank you, I will look into it. But to be completely honest I am happy with it as it is. Runescape runs entirely on 600ms as far as I know so I don’t see why I should change it for this. But then, it is up to you the user to tell me what to add so I guess I’ll give it a shot when I get home

hotkid8200:

How do i contact you? like skype! please answer back!

Why do you wish to contact me?

Read full topic

item.title: Project Pooeybum [Runesource][Completed]
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Not sure if Stonefall is different(supposedly is runesource too) but you could check it out too…

Stonefall - A RuneSource Derivative

Basic event handling system - Actions can be delayed or repeated using a simple threaded event handler. Can fire events in multiples of ticks, seconds, minutes and hours.

Read full topic

@doom_j wrote:

Well you could make the task system use both the cycle rate and then also have it execute tasks at a different rate.

item.title: Project Pooeybum [Runesource][Completed]
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

The server only cycles at 600ms though… Things can only happen at 600ms. I suppose if you tried something similar to the delta cycle time system but I think if you do that and the thing takes more than 600ms the server might complain as it can only do one task at a time. (this is all me speculating and the best way to find out is to try)

Read full topic

item.title: Project Pooeybum [Runesource][Completed]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

BorigTheDwarf:

The time when the damage is done is when the hit connects. Getting the hit to occur in time with the animation doesn’t really work. I tried my best but yeah.

what about a double tick?
instead of tick(1) //600ms
tick((double)0.001)) //0.6ms

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf

The time when the damage is done is when the hit connects. Getting the hit to occur in time with the animation doesn’t really work. I tried my best but yeah.

item.title: Project Pooeybum [Runesource][Completed]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“BorigTheDwarf, post:25, topic:438733”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=541440.msg3972235#msg3972235 date=1334271666]

Lol’d at the continuous negative responses about the name, I’m sure he’s gotten the message by now, you don’t need to pipe in with your two-cents people. A statement only needs to be said once, if said effectively.

OT: I’m curious about the development. This was the only project I was interested in… What’s your game-plan since you’ve released this?

[size=1pt](Consider this a bump as well.)[/size]

I’m going to keep going until people are happy to use it. The current release doesn’t seem to be quiet beating Project Insanity so I guess I have to keep trying. Any suggestions on what I should add?

At the same time I was considering using what I have now as a base for a true role playing server. One that is heavily quest oriented, possibly with an actual story line. I would also be considering a complete overhaul of skills system, maybe introducing some kind of leveling up method to remove some of the grind of traditional Runescape.

add the boring stuff lol,
using your prototype now to get some feeling with runesource but it doesn’t have enough content yet to really build a server on it, for most people including me without experience with runesource.

One thing what bothered me a bit is the hitsplats delay, they only appear like a second after the hit
[/quote]

That’s because I wrote everything using the ticks system. I have never written combat before and haven’t played Runescape in years so I was actually just guessing as to how it worked for a lot of it. As the server runs on a cycle of 600ms I don’t know how I would be able to make anything happen quicker than 600ms.[/quote]
write out the splat the same moment as the hit occurs? without putting a tick for it

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:22, topic:438733”]Lol’d at the continuous negative responses about the name, I’m sure he’s gotten the message by now, you don’t need to pipe in with your two-cents people. A statement only needs to be said once, if said effectively.

OT: I’m curious about the development. This was the only project I was interested in… What’s your game-plan since you’ve released this?

[size=1pt](Consider this a bump as well.)[/size][/quote]

I’m going to keep going until people are happy to use it. The current release doesn’t seem to be quiet beating Project Insanity so I guess I have to keep trying. Any suggestions on what I should add?

At the same time I was considering using what I have now as a base for a true role playing server. One that is heavily quest oriented, possibly with an actual story line. I would also be considering a complete overhaul of skills system, maybe introducing some kind of leveling up method to remove some of the grind of traditional Runescape.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“BorigTheDwarf, post:20, topic:438733”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=541440.msg3969501#msg3969501 date=1334021064]

We’re not insulting the name because you’re uniquely immature. We’re insulting the name because you are immature, regardless of how others act. We insult all immaturity.

Awww bubba. So you profess to have this immense immaturity? Why then do you get so hot and bothered over “Pooeybum”. Either you’re anally retentive or you’re desperately trying to impress on others that you are oh so mature.

Yes, definitely, because the only possible reason for acting mature would be for others’ benefit.
No, false. I don’t act immature because I find immature people annoying. Grow up already.
[/quote]

I don’t see anything in the slightest that is mature about what you are doing right now.[/quote]
Nor do I see anything you are doing that is immature. If you wish to insult me, fair enough, but I only accept insults from credible sources.

Read full topic
